tasks.title: Set up database schema for tasks and users
tasks.description: Design and implement the core database structure to store user accounts, tasks, and categories. This foundation enables all data persistence and relationships between users and their tasks.
tasks.featureContext: Users need permanent storage for their tasks and secure account management
acceptanceCriteria: Users table stores email, password hash, and metadata
Tasks table stores title, description, due date, status, category reference
Categories table stores name and user reference
Foreign key relationships properly enforce data integrity
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle database connection failures gracefully
Ensure proper indexing for performance

tasks.title: Implement user registration and login API
tasks.description: Build secure authentication endpoints that allow users to create accounts and authenticate. This enables user-specific task storage and access control across the application.
tasks.featureContext: Users need secure accounts to protect their task data
acceptanceCriteria: POST /register creates new user with hashed password
POST /login validates credentials and returns secure token
Password validation enforces minimum security requirements
Proper error handling for duplicate emails and invalid credentials
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle duplicate email registration attempts
Rate limit login attempts to prevent brute force

tasks.title: Create authentication middleware and session management
tasks.description: Implement middleware to verify user tokens and manage authenticated sessions. This ensures only authorized users can access their tasks and provides seamless login state management.
tasks.featureContext: Users need persistent login sessions and route protection
acceptanceCriteria: Middleware validates JWT tokens on protected routes
Invalid tokens return 401 unauthorized error
User context is available in protected route handlers
Token refresh mechanism works correctly
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle expired tokens gracefully
Manage concurrent sessions from multiple devices

tasks.title: Build login and registration user interface
tasks.description: Create responsive forms for user authentication with proper validation and error handling. This provides the entry point for users to access their personal task management workspace.
tasks.featureContext: Users need an intuitive way to create accounts and log in
acceptanceCriteria: Registration form validates email format and password strength
Login form handles authentication errors gracefully
Forms are responsive and accessible
Success states redirect users to main task view
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle network timeouts during form submission
Provide clear feedback for validation errors

tasks.title: Implement main application layout and navigation
tasks.description: Create the core UI structure with header, navigation, and main content areas. This provides the foundation for all task management interfaces and ensures consistent user experience.
tasks.featureContext: Users need a clear, organized interface to manage their tasks
acceptanceCriteria: Header displays user info and logout option
Navigation allows switching between main views
Layout is responsive across desktop and mobile
Loading states are handled appropriately
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle very long task lists without breaking layout
Graceful degradation on smaller screens

tasks.title: Build task creation API endpoint
tasks.description: Implement backend endpoint to create new tasks with validation for required fields. This core functionality enables users to capture and store their work items in the system.
tasks.featureContext: Task creation is the primary entry point for task management
acceptanceCriteria: POST /tasks creates task with title, description, due date
Validates required fields and returns appropriate errors
Associates task with authenticated user
Returns created task with generated ID
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle very long task titles and descriptions
Validate due date format and reasonable ranges

tasks.title: Build task retrieval and listing API
tasks.description: Implement endpoint to fetch user's tasks with basic sorting and pagination. This enables users to view their existing tasks and forms the foundation for task management workflows.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to view and access their existing tasks
acceptanceCriteria: GET /tasks returns user's tasks sorted by creation date
Supports pagination for large task lists
Only returns tasks belonging to authenticated user
Includes all task fields including status and category
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle users with hundreds of tasks efficiently
Return empty list gracefully for new users

tasks.title: Build task update and deletion API
tasks.description: Implement endpoints for editing existing tasks and deleting unwanted tasks. This completes the core CRUD operations and allows users to maintain their task lists effectively.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to modify and remove tasks as their work evolves
acceptanceCriteria: PUT /tasks/:id updates task fields with validation
DELETE /tasks/:id removes task permanently
Operations only succeed for task owner
Returns appropriate errors for non-existent tasks
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle deletion of non-existent tasks gracefully
Prevent users from modifying other users' tasks

tasks.title: Create task creation form component
tasks.description: Build an intuitive form interface for creating new tasks with fields for title, description, and due date. This provides users with a smooth task entry experience and proper input validation.
tasks.featureContext: Users need a quick, efficient way to capture new tasks
acceptanceCriteria: Form includes title, description, and due date fields
Client-side validation prevents empty submissions
Form resets after successful task creation
Error handling displays server validation messages
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle form submission during network interruption
Prevent duplicate submissions from rapid clicking

tasks.title: Build task list display component
tasks.description: Create a responsive component to display tasks in an organized list format with visual hierarchy. This serves as the main interface where users interact with their tasks daily.
tasks.featureContext: Users need a clear overview of all their tasks
acceptanceCriteria: Displays tasks in chronological order with clear visual separation
Shows task title, description, due date, and status
Responsive design works on mobile and desktop
Loading states while fetching tasks
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle empty task list with helpful messaging
Graceful handling of very long task titles

tasks.title: Implement task editing and deletion interface
tasks.description: Build intuitive controls for editing task details and deleting tasks with confirmation dialogs. This completes the core task management workflow and ensures users can maintain their task lists.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to modify tasks as requirements change
acceptanceCriteria: Edit mode toggles inline or in modal dialog
Delete action requires user confirmation
Changes are saved automatically or with clear save button
Cancel option restores original values
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle edit conflicts when task is modified elsewhere
Prevent accidental deletion with confirmation step

tasks.title: Build category management API
tasks.description: Implement backend endpoints for creating, updating, and deleting task categories. This enables users to organize their tasks into meaningful groups and provides the foundation for category-based filtering.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to organize tasks into logical groups
acceptanceCriteria: CRUD operations for categories with name and color
Categories are user-specific and properly isolated
Handles category deletion when tasks are assigned
Returns categories sorted alphabetically
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle deletion of category with assigned tasks
Prevent duplicate category names for same user

tasks.title: Implement task status toggle functionality
tasks.description: Build the core complete/incomplete status management with visual feedback. This provides users with the satisfying experience of marking tasks complete while maintaining visibility of their accomplishments.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to track task completion progress
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking checkbox toggles task completion status
Status change persists to database immediately
Visual feedback confirms status change
Completed tasks remain visible but distinguished
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle rapid clicking to prevent state conflicts
Graceful fallback if status update fails

tasks.title: Build due date tracking and visual indicators
tasks.description: Implement due date assignment and visual highlighting for upcoming and overdue tasks. This helps users prioritize their work and avoid missing important deadlines.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to prioritize tasks based on deadlines
acceptanceCriteria: Tasks display due dates with appropriate formatting
Overdue tasks are visually highlighted in red
Tasks due soon show warning indicators
Date picker allows easy due date selection
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle timezone differences correctly
Display relative dates (today, tomorrow, next week)

tasks.title: Create category selection and management interface
tasks.description: Build UI components for creating categories and assigning them to tasks. This enables users to organize their tasks into meaningful groups and provides visual organization through color coding.
tasks.featureContext: Users need intuitive ways to categorize and organize tasks
acceptanceCriteria: Dropdown or selector for assigning categories to tasks
Interface for creating new categories with names and colors
Categories display with consistent color coding
Category management doesn't disrupt task creation flow
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle users with many categories gracefully
Provide default uncategorized option

tasks.title: Enhance task list with completion status visual design
tasks.description: Improve task list display to clearly distinguish completed and active tasks with strikethrough text, opacity changes, and visual hierarchy. This provides immediate visual feedback on progress and accomplishments.
tasks.featureContext: Users need clear visual feedback on task completion
acceptanceCriteria: Completed tasks show strikethrough text and reduced opacity
Checkboxes clearly indicate completion state
Completed tasks group separately or sort to bottom
Visual design remains accessible and readable
edgeCasesToHandle: Ensure completed tasks remain readable
Handle long lists with many completed items

tasks.title: Implement task sorting and basic organization features
tasks.description: Add sorting options for tasks by due date, creation date, and completion status. This helps users organize their view and focus on the most relevant tasks for their current priorities.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to prioritize tasks effectively
acceptanceCriteria: Users can sort tasks by due date, creation date, or status
Default sort shows incomplete tasks first, then by due date
Sort selection persists during session
Sorting works efficiently with large task lists
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle tasks with no due date in sorting
Maintain stable sort order for equal items

tasks.title: Build search functionality for tasks
tasks.description: Implement text search across task titles and descriptions with real-time filtering. This enables users to quickly find specific tasks in large lists and improves overall productivity.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to find specific tasks quickly
acceptanceCriteria: Search input filters tasks by title and description text
Results update in real-time as user types
Search is case-insensitive and handles partial matches
Clear search option restores full task list
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle search with special characters and symbols
Optimize search performance for large task lists

tasks.title: Implement category and status filtering
tasks.description: Build filtering interface to show only tasks from specific categories or with particular completion status. This helps users focus on relevant subsets of their work and reduces cognitive load.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to focus on specific types of tasks
acceptanceCriteria: Filter options for category, completion status, and due date ranges
Multiple filters can be applied simultaneously
Active filters are clearly displayed with remove options
Filter state persists during session
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle filter combinations that return no results
Clear indication when filters are active

tasks.title: Optimize application performance and loading states
tasks.description: Implement performance optimizations including lazy loading, caching, and smooth loading states. This ensures the application remains responsive even with large numbers of tasks and provides a polished user experience.
tasks.featureContext: Users expect fast, responsive applications
acceptanceCriteria: Task lists load within 2 seconds on average
Search and filtering responses are under 500ms
Smooth loading states for all async operations
Pagination or virtual scrolling for large task lists
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle slow network connections gracefully
Prevent UI blocking during heavy operations

tasks.title: Conduct final testing and bug fixes
tasks.description: Perform comprehensive testing across all features, browsers, and devices to identify and fix critical issues. This ensures a stable launch with minimal user-facing problems.
tasks.featureContext: Users need a reliable, bug-free experience
acceptanceCriteria: All core user flows work without errors
Application functions correctly on major browsers
Mobile responsiveness verified across devices
Error handling provides helpful user feedback
edgeCasesToHandle: Test with various data volumes and edge cases
Verify graceful degradation for network issues

cycles.name: Organization & Enhancement
cycles.description: Categories, due dates, and user experience polish
